{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3538540,"name":"Brayden DeGraff","username":"Brayden135","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/e0b2c6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T19:56:17.235Z","cooked":"

Hi, I was configuring the new radio for 2025. I updated the firmware and completed the setup, including flipping the switch on the back. However, when I try to connect, the WiFi doesn’t show up on the computer. But when I tether it via Ethernet, it connects.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T19:56:17.235Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":128,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":662.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493002,"topic_slug":"new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer","display_username":"Brayden DeGraff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62768,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer/493002/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3538550,"name":"Josh","username":"AegisNova","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aegisnova/{size}/265035_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T20:06:59.908Z","cooked":"

I am unsure of the full details, but I believe I saw somewhere that these new radios have two different frequency settings and you have to either adjust the radio or your computer to pick up the signals.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T20:06:59.908Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":25.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493002,"topic_slug":"new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer","display_username":"Josh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FTC 6603 Project Manager | Former Disruptive Innovator FRC 6317"},"post_url":"/t/new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer/493002/2","custom_user_title":"FTC 6603 Project Manager | Former Disruptive Innovator FRC 6317","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3538556,"name":"RoboGeek","username":"Aaron_Li","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaron_li/{size}/10195_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T20:11:23.877Z","cooked":"

I don’t have first hand experience with the radios, but I’ve come across a few threads, hopefully they’ll help

Unable to find robot's wifi Technical
We have updated our radio, set up the team number and all that. Even after doing all that, we can’t find our robot’s Wi-Fi. Does anyone know of a solution?
Robot radio not transmitting WIFI! Can't connect to robot Technical
As the title insists, we’re having trouble with out radio. I believe it is the vh-109 FRC radio model. It stopped working randomly after months of working fine. We thought it might’ve shorted but it still turns on so that might not be it. It turns on but wont transmit wifi so we can’t connect to it and actually run the robot. We’ve tried going into the network assistant tool to configure it but it won’t connect through that either. It detects the ethernet cable but won’t let us reconfigure it. I…
Setting up the vivid radio Technical
I can’t tell if we are doing something wrong or our vivid radio doesn’t work. I have powered it with a 12v dc power supply. I have connected an ethernet to the roborio I have connected an ethernet to my laptop. The power, SYS and the robot lights are green. Two more lights are off. I think they are both wifi leds The “radio” light on the roborio is off When all three dipswitches are set to off, I was able to access radio.local in the browser. I was able to enter my team number in. I put …
2xVH-109 stopped working Control System
In the past 2 hours, our two radios stopped working. Both were configured as robot client, with 2.4GHz. One just stopped interacting virtually, meaning the correct lights were on (1,3,5 solid, 2 blinking), but it didn’t respond on 192.168.69.1 (connection refused) The other one, stopped showing the SSID (same lights as the previous case), and when connecting to the DS port, it didn’t show the robot. (In this case, when trying to connect with Ethernet to the rio, it didn’t go well either, only…

The new radio runs on the 6 GhZ band. If your computer doesn’t support that band, you won’t be able to find the network.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T20:12:47.720Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493002,"topic_slug":"new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8847A | PV"},"post_url":"/t/new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer/493002/4","custom_user_title":"8847A | PV","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3538561,"name":"Pat Mattin","username":"pmattin5459","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pmattin5459/{size}/182786_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T20:13:56.725Z","cooked":"

To use 6ghz mode, you need a laptop with Wifi 6. Unlikely you have that, so you need a second radio to act as a bridge between your laptop and the robot radio. See the docs here.

We have also had this problem. After asking around we found the consensus was that the ultimate solution is using another radio to create an access point. There docs about how to do this on VividHosting. We don’t have a laptop that supports 6ghz so we are currently power cycling the radio a bunch until it dumb-luck boots into 2.4ghz mode so we can connect.

Can you describe what LED’s are on on the Radio? The 2.4GHZ light should be illuminated solid according to the docs.

Have you set the mode to Robot radio on the radio.local page?

If you only have a single VH-109 you’ll want to configure it as a robot radio and flip dip switch 3 into the on position to enable 2.4GHz.
Documentation for this configuration here
https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/practicing-at-home#id-2.4ghz-access-point

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-25T06:52:01.225Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":493002,"topic_slug":"new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/practicing-at-home#id-2.4ghz-access-point","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Practicing At Home | FIRST FRC Radio","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/new-radio-not-appearing-on-computer/493002/9","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3539102,"name":"Kevin Emery","username":"Kpchem","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kpchem/{size}/122235_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T07:17:57.923Z","cooked":"

Even if their computer does have Wifi 6 support, the VH-109 cannot serve as an access point (for others to connect to) while on the robot due to FCC restrictions.

To connect wirelessly to the robot, you either have to (1) use 2.4Ghz after flipping the appropriate dipswitch on the back or (2) set up a separate 6Ghz access point powered from the wall (whether that be a VH-109, VH-113, or other 6 Ghz AP), and then connect the computer as well as the robot radio to the access point.
